vote.question: On the Cloture Motion S.Amdt. 1183
vote.title: Motion to Invoke Cloture on Leahy Amdt. No. 1183 As Modified; To strengthen border security and enforcement.

vote.question: On the Motion to Table S.Amdt. 1251
vote.title: Motion to Table Cornyn Amdt. No. 1251; Requiring Enforcement, Security and safety while Upgrading Lawful Trade and travel Simultaneously (RESULTS).

vote.question: On the Nomination
vote.title: Confirmation Michael Froman, of New York, to be U.S. Trade Representative

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 1227
vote.title: Heller Amdt. No. 1227; To include a representative from the Southwestern State of Nevada on the Southern Border Security Commission.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 1208
vote.title: Lee Amdt. No. 1208 As Modified; To require fast-track congressional approval when the Secretary of Homeland Security notifies Congress of the implementation of the border security strategies and certifies that the strategies are substantially operational.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 1268
vote.title: Manchin Amdt. No. 1268; To provide for common sense limitations on salaries for contractor executives and employees involved in border security.

vote.question: On the Motion to Table S.Amdt. 1200
vote.title: Motion to Table Paul Amdt. No. 1200; To provide for enhanced border security, including strong border security metrics and congressional votes on border security and for other purposes.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 1198
vote.title: Tester Amdt. No. 1198; To modify the Border Oversight Task Force to include tribal government officials.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 1228
vote.title: Vitter Amdt. No. 1228; To prohibit the temporary grant of legal status to, or adjustment to citizenship status of, any individual who is unlawfully present in the United States until the Secretary of Homeland Security certifies that the US-VISIT System (a biometric border check-in and check-out system first required by Congress in 1996) has been fully implemented at every land, sea, and airport of entry and Congress passes a joint resolution, under fast track procedures, stating that such integrated entry and exit data system has been sufficiently implemented.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 1197
vote.title: Thune Amdt. No. 1197; To require the completion of the 350 miles of reinforced, double-layered fencing described in section 102(b)(1)(A) of the Illegal Immigration Reform and Immigrant Responsibility Act of 1996 before registered provisional immigrant status may be granted and to require the completion of 700 miles of such fencing before the status of registered provisional immigrants may be adjusted to permanent resident status.

vote.question: On the Nomination
vote.title: Confirmation Jeffrey L. Schmehl, of Pennsylvania, to be United States District Judge

vote.question: On the Motion to Table S.Amdt. 1195
vote.title: Motion to Table Grassley Amdt. No. 1195; To prohibit the granting of registered provisional immigrant status until the Secretary has maintained effective control of the borders for 6 months.

vote.title: Motion to Invoke Cloture on S. 954; An original bill to reauthorize agricultural programs through 2018.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 987
vote.title: Moran Amdt. No. 987; To require the Federal Crop Insurance Corporation to carry out research and development regarding a crop insurance program for alfalfa.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 953
vote.title: Durbin Amdt. No. 953; To limit the amount of premium subsidy provided by the Federal Crop Insurance Corporation on behalf of any person or legal entity with an average adjusted gross income in excess of $750,000, with a delayed application of the limitation until completion of a study on the effects of the limitation.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 1031
vote.title: Hagan Amdt. No. 1031; To authorize the use of the insurance fund to reduce fraud and maintain program integrity in the crop insurance program.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 923
vote.title: Feinstein Amdt. No. 923; To prohibit the payment by the Federal Crop Insurance Corporation of any portion of the premium for a policy or plan of insurance for tobacco.

vote.title: Confirmation Srikanth Srinivasan, of Virginia, to be U.S. Circuit Judge for D.C. Circuit

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 965
vote.title: Sanders Amdt. No. 965; To permit States to require that any food, beverage, or other edible product offered for sale have a label on indicating that the food, beverage, or other edible product contains a genetically engineered ingredient.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 925
vote.title: Shaheen Amdt. No. 925; To reform the Federal sugar program, and for other purposes.

vote.question: On the Resolution
vote.title: S. Res. 65 as Amended; A resolution strongly supporting the full implementation of United States and international sanctions on Iran and urging the President to continue to strengthen enforcement of sanctions legislation.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 960
vote.title: Inhofe Amdt. No. 960; To repeal the nutrition entitlement programs and establish a nutrition assistance block grant program.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 931
vote.title: Gillibrand Amdt. No. 931; To strike a reduction in the supplemental nutrition assistance program, with an offset that limits crop insurance reimbursements to providers.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 948
vote.title: Roberts Amdt. No. 948; To improve and extend certain nutrition programs.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 919
vote.title: Cantwell Amdt. No. 919; To allow Indian tribes to participate in certain soil and water conservation programs.

vote.question: On Passage of the Bill
vote.title: S.601, As Amended; A bill to provide for the conservation and development of water and related resources, to authorize the Secretary of the Army to construct various projects for improvements to rivers and harbors of the United States, and for other purposes.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 866
vote.title: Merkley Amdt. No. 866; To require the use of American iron, steel, and manufactured goods for innovative financing pilot projects.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 816
vote.title: Coburn Amdt. No. 816; To remove restrictions on projects the Infrastructure Deauthorization Commission may consider.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 815
vote.title: Coburn Amdt. No. 815; To stop Federal subsidies for ongoing beach renourishment from being extended to 65 years.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 889
vote.title: Sanders Amdt. No. 889; To address restoration of certain properties impacted by natural disasters, and for other purposes.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 868

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 813
vote.title: Brown Amdt. No. 813 As Modified; To provide a multiagency effort to slow the spread of Asian carp in the Upper Mississippi and Ohio River basins and tributaries.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 803
vote.title: Whitehouse Amdt. No. 803; To create the National Endowment for the Oceans to promote the protection and conservation of United States ocean, coastal, and Great Lakes ecosystems.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 805
vote.title: Coburn Amdt. No. 805; To protect the right of individuals to bear arms at water resources development projects administered by the Secretary of the Army.

vote.title: Confirmation Derrick Kahala Watson, of Hawaii, to be U.S. District Judge

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 730
vote.title: Harkin Amdt. No. 730; To reauthorize and improve programs related to mental health and substance use disorders.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 717
vote.title: Barrasso Amdt. No. 717; To withhold 5 percent of Community Oriented Policing Services program Federal funding from States and local governments that release sensitive and confidential information on law-abiding gun owners and victims of domestic violence.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 714
vote.title: Lautenberg Amdt. No. 714; To regulate large capacity ammunition feeding devices.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 720
vote.title: Burr Amdt. No. 720; To protect the Second Amendment rights of veterans and their families.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 711
vote.title: Feinstein Amdt. No. 711; To regulate assault weapons, to ensure that the right to keep and bear arms is not unlimited, and for other purposes.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 719
vote.title: Cornyn Amdt. No. 719; To allow reciprocity for the carrying of certain concealed firearms.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 713
vote.title: Leahy Amdt. No. 713; To increase public safety by punishing and deterring firearms trafficking.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 725
vote.title: Grassley Amdt. No. 725; To address gun violence, improve the availability of records to the National Instant Criminal Background Check System, address mental illness in the criminal justice system, and end straw purchases and trafficking of illegal firearms, and for other purposes.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 715
vote.title: Manchin Amdt. No. 715; To protect Second Amendment rights, ensure that all individuals who should be prohibited from buying a firearm are listed in the National Instant Criminal Background Check System, and provide a responsible and consistent background check process.

vote.question: On the Nomination
vote.title: Nomination: Beverly Reid O'Connell of California, to be U.S. District Judge for the Central District of California

vote.question: On Cloture on the Motion to Proceed
vote.title: Motion to Invoke Cloture on the Motion to Proceed to S.649; A bill to ensure that all individuals who should be prohibited from buying a firearm are listed in the national instant criminal background check system and require a background check for every firearm sale, and for other purposes.

vote.title: Confirmation Sarah Jewell, of Washington, to be Secretary of the Interior

vote.question: On the Nomination
vote.title: Confirmation Patty Shwartz, of New Jersey, to be U.S. Circuit Judge for the Third Circuit

vote.question: On the Resolution
vote.title: S. Con. Res. 8; An original concurrent resolution setting forth the congressional budget for the United States Government for fiscal year 2014, revising the appropriate budgetary levels for fiscal year 2013, and setting forth the appropriate budgetary levels for fiscal years 2015 through 2023.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 139
vote.title: Inhofe Amdt. No. 139; To uphold Second Amendment rights and prevent the United States from entering into the United Nations Arms Trade Treaty.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 154
vote.title: Portman Amdt. No. 154; To require the Congressional Budget Office to include macroeconomic feedback scoring of tax legislation.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 709
vote.title: Coburn Amdt. No. 709; To eliminate program duplication, fragmentation, and overlap within the 15 "financial literacy" programs under 13 departments and agencies identified by the 2012 report of the Government Accountability Office, entitled "Opportunities to Reduce Duplication, Overlap and Fragmentation, Achieve Savings, and Enhance Revenue".

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 416
vote.title: Coburn Amdt. No. 416; To establish a deficit-neutral reserve fund to eliminate non-defense related spending by the Department of Defense.

vote.question: On the Motion S.Amdt. 673
vote.title: Motion to Waive CBA Re: Lee Amdt. No. 673; To create a point of order against legislation that would further restrict the right of law-abiding Americans to own a firearm.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 702
vote.title: Cruz Amdt. No. 702; To create a point of order against any legislation that would provide taxpayer funds to the United Nations while any member nation forces citizens or residents of that nation to undergo involuntary abortions.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 471
vote.title: Cruz Amdt. No. 471; To establish a deficit-neutral reserve fund to reduce foreign assistance to Egypt and increase funding for an east coast missile defense shield.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 338
vote.title: Vitter Amdt. No. 338; To end the mobile phone welfare program.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 526
vote.title: Vitter Amdt. No. 526; To establish a deficit-neutral reserve fund to ensure election integrity by requiring a valid government-issued photographic ID for voting in federal elections.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 382
vote.title: Paul Amdt. No. 382; To provide funding to the Department of Transportation for interstate bridge infrastructure projects and to reduce the Federal deficit by decreasing the amounts available for foreign assistance and loan guarantee programs administered by the Department of Energy.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 318
vote.title: Crapo Amdt. No. 318; To amend the reconciliation instructions to include instructions to the Committee on Finance to achieve the Budget's stated goal of $275 billion in mandatory health care savings.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 136
vote.title: Ayotte Amdt. No. 136; To establish a deficit-neutral reserve fund for the prohibition on funding of the Medium Extended Air Defense System.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 340
vote.title: Shelby Amdt. No. 340; To establish a deficit-neutral reserve fund for legislation that requires financial regulators to conduct rigorous cost-benefit analyses on all proposed rules.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 152
vote.title: Portman Amdt. No. 152; To provide reconciliation instructions to reduce the deficit by $63,860,000,000 for the period of fiscal years 2014 through 2023.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 614
vote.title: Sessions Amdt. No. 614; To establish a deficit-neutral reserve fund to achieve savings by prohibiting illegal immigrants or illegal immigrants granted legal status from qualifying for federally subsidized health care.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 359
vote.title: Inhofe Amdt. No. 359; To reduce spending and decrease the risk of drastic energy price increases by prohibiting further greenhouse gas regulations for the purposes of addressing climate change.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 597
vote.title: Scott Amdt. No. 597; To establish a deficit-neutral reserve fund relating to the prohibition of taxpayer dollars and resources being used to automatically deduct union dues from the pay of Federal employees.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 213
vote.title: Johnson (WI) Amdt. No. 213; To force Congress to ensure the solvency of the Social Security and Medicare programs.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 373
vote.title: Lee Amdt. No. 373; To provide a point of order against budgets spending more on net interest payments on the debt than on national defense, and to ensure the United States government funds its military at higher levels than the militaries of foreign holders of its debt.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 514
vote.title: Coats Amdt. No. 514; To establish a deficit-neutral reserve fund to enable prompt action relating to the Presidential exemption for the rule of the Environmental Protection Agency commonly known as the Mercury and Air Toxins Standard for affected electric utility steam generating units that need additional time to install the major emissions control equipment, construct replacement generation, or implement other mitigation measures in order to ensure the reliability of the grid.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 535
vote.title: Toomey Amdt. No. 535; To repeal the tax increase on catastrophic medical expenses created by Obamacare.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 689
vote.title: Vitter Amdt. No. 689; To end "Too Big To Fail" subsidies or funding advantage for Wall Street mega-banks (over $500 billion in total assets).

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 263
vote.title: Paul Amdt. No. 263; In the nature of a substitute.

vote.question: On the Motion S.Amdt. 697
vote.title: Motion to Waive CBA Re: Burr Amdt. No. 697; To create a point of order against legislation that would raise taxes on veterans, and for other purposes.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 307
vote.title: Thune Amdt. No. 307; To establish a deficit-neutral reserve fund to permanently eliminate the Federal estate tax.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 693
vote.title: Warner Amdt. No. 693; To repeal or reduce the estate tax, but only if done in a fiscally responsible way.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 138
vote.title: Isakson Amdt. No. 138; To establish a deficit-neutral reserve fund relating to establishing a biennial budget and appropriations process.

vote.question: On the Motion S.Amdt. 292
vote.title: Motion to Waive CBA Re: Rubio Amdt. No. 292; To express the sense of the Senate to enact Child Interstate Abortion Notification Act.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 515
vote.title: Alexander Amdt. No. 515; To establish a deficit-neutral reserve fund related to the education of low-income children, which may include allowing funding under the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 to follow children from low-income families to the school children attend.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 656
vote.title: Enzi Amdt. No. 656; Of a perfecting nature.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 494
vote.title: Hoeven Amdt. No. 494; To establish a deficit-neutral reserve fund to promote investment and job growth in United States manufacturing, oil and gas production, and refining sectors through the construction of the Keystone XL Pipeline.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 622
vote.title: Boxer Amdt. No. 622; To establish a deficit-neutral reserve fund relating to protecting the interests of the United States in making a decision relating to the Keystone XL pipeline.

vote.question: On the Motion S.Amdt. 261
vote.title: Motion to Waive CBA Re: Blunt Amdt. No. 261; To create a point of order against legislation that would create a Federal tax or fee on carbon emissions.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 646
vote.title: Whitehouse Amdt. No. 646; To establish a deficit-neutral reserve fund relating to ensuring that all revenue from a fee on carbon pollution is returned to the American people.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 409
vote.title: Coburn Amdt. No. 409; To establish a deficit-neutral reserve fund to sunset the provision of Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act that increases payments to hospitals in a few States by reducing payments to the majority of States through the Medicare hospital wage index.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 651
vote.title: Menendez Amdt. No. 651; To call for a comprehensive approach for wage index reform.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 630
vote.title: Fischer Amdt. No. 630; To establish a deficit-neutral reserve fund to protect women's access to health care, including primary and preventive care, in a manner consistent with protecting rights of conscience.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 438
vote.title: Shaheen Amdt. No. 438; To establish a deficit-neutral reserve fund to protect women's access to health care, including primary and preventative health care, family planning and birth control, and employer-provided contraceptive coverage, such as was provided under the Affordable Care Act (PL 111-148).

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 222
vote.title: Crapo Amdt. No. 222; To establish a deficit neutral reserve fund to repeal the tax increases enacted under the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act that were imposed on low- and middle-income Americans.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 439
vote.title: Murray Amdt. No. 439; To amend the deficit-neutral reserve fund for tax relief to provide tax relief for low and middle income families.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 202
vote.title: Cruz Amdt. No. 202; To establish a deficit-neutral reserve fund to provide for the repeal of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act and the Health Care and Education Reconciliation Act of 2010 and to encourage patient-centered reforms to improve health outcomes and reduce health care costs, promoting economic growth.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 158
vote.title: Ayotte Amdt. No. 158; To prohibit the consideration of a budget resolution that includes revenue increases while the civilian unemployment rate is above 5.5 percent, the administration's prediction for the unemployment rate without the stimulus.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 156
vote.title: Grassley Amdt. No. 156; To protect Americans from a $1,000,000,000,000 tax increase and provide for pro-growth revenue-neutral comprehensive tax reform.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 432
vote.title: Stabenow Amdt. No. 432; To establish a deficit-neutral reserve fund to protect Medicare's guaranteed benefits and to prohibit replacing guaranteed benefits with the House passed budget plan to turn Medicare into a voucher program.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 297
vote.title: Hatch Amdt. No. 297; To promote innovation, preserve high-paying jobs, and encourage economic growth for manufacturers of lifesaving medical devices and cutting edge medical therapies.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 433
vote.title: Murray Amdt. No. 433; To amend the resolution.

vote.question: On the Motion to Recommit
vote.title: Sessions Motion to Recommit S.Con.Res. 8 to the Committee on the Budget; An original concurrent resolution setting forth the congressional budget for the United States Government for fiscal year 2014, revising the appropriate budgetary levels for fiscal year 2013, and setting forth the appropriate budgetary levels for fiscal years 2015 through 2023.

vote.title: Toomey Amdt. No. 115 As Modified; To increase by $25,000,000 the amount appropriated for Operation and Maintenance for the Department of Defense for programs, projects, and activities in the continental United States, and to provide an offset.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 93
vote.title: Coburn Amdt. No. 93; To transfer appropriations from the National Heritage Partnership Program to fund the resumption of public tours of the White House and visitor services and maintenance at national parks and monuments.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 69
vote.title: Coburn Amdt. No. 69; To prohibit Urban Area Security Initiative grant recipients from funding projects that do not improve homeland security.

vote.question: On the Cloture Motion S.Amdt. 26
vote.title: Motion to Invoke Cloture on the Mikulski Amdt. No. 26; In the nature of a substitute.

vote.title: Coburn Amdt. No. 66; To temporarily freeze the hiring of nonessential Federal employees.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 53

vote.title: Motion to Table McCain Amdt. No. 33; To strike certain authorities relating to the use for grants of funds of the Office of Economic Assistance of the Department of Defense.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 30
vote.title: Cruz Amdt. No. 30; To prohibit the use of funds to carry out the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 16
vote.title: Coburn Amdt. No. 16; To amend the requirements for speedy notice to victims and to require a report to Congress.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 15
vote.title: Coburn Amdt. No. 15; To more quickly resolve rape cases and reduce the deficit by consolidating unnecessary duplication within the Department of Justice.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 10
vote.title: Portman Amdt. No. 10; To clarify that child victims of sex trafficking are eligible to receive assistance under grants provided to enhance the safety of youth and children.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 21
vote.title: Leahy Amdt. No. 21 as Modified; To authorize appropriations for fiscal years 2014 through 2017 for the Trafficking Victims Protection Act of 2000, to enhance measures to combat trafficking in persons, and for other purposes.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 13
vote.title: Coburn Amdt. No. 13; To reaffirm the inalienable rights of every American citizen guaranteed by the Constitution of the United States.

vote.title: Motion to Table Vitter Motion to Commit H.R. 325 to the Committee on Finance; A bill to ensure the complete and timely payment of the obligations of the United States Government until May 19, 2013, and for other purposes.

vote.question: On the Motion to Table S.Amdt. 9
vote.title: Motion to Table Paul Amdt. No. 9; To prohibit the sale, lease, transfer, retransfer, or delivery of F-16 aircraft, M1 tanks, or certain other defense articles or services to the Government of Egypt.

vote.question: On the Motion to Table S.Amdt. 8
vote.title: Motion to Table Toomey Amdt. No. 8; To protect Social Security benefits and military pay and require that the United States Government prioritize all obligations on the debt held by the public in the event that the debt limit is reached.

vote.question: On the Motion to Table S.Amdt. 7
vote.title: Motion to Table Portman Amdt. No. 7; To amend title 31, United States Code, to provide for automatic continuing resolutions.
